thread.title: Murdoch: Carson Would Be 'Real Black President'
thread.title_full: Murdoch: Carson Would Be 'Real Black President'

title: Murdoch: Carson Would Be 'Real Black President'
text: Privacy Policy | More Newsletters Andy Kropa /Invision/AP Rupert Murdoch attends the WSJ. Magazine 2014 Innovator Awards at MoMA on Wednesday, Nov. 5, 2014, in New York. Media tycoon Rupert Murdoch has suggested that President Barack Obama is not a "real black president,” NBC News reported. The 84-year-old tweeted late Wednesday that Republican presidential nominee Ben Carson would give the U.S. "a real black president who can properly address the racial divide." Ben and Candy Carson terrific. What about a real black President who can properly address the racial divide? And much else. — Rupert Murdoch (@rupertmurdoch) October 8, 2015 Murdoch's tweet praised Carson, the only African-American running in the 2016 race, and his wife, Candy, as "terrific," shortly after promoting the nominee's appearance on "The Kelly File" on his Fox News Channel. The message sparked controversy on Twitter.
